energy.usef.agr.service.business

Class AgrValidationBusinessService

  • java.lang.Object
    • energy.usef.agr.service.business.AgrValidationBusinessService

  • public class AgrValidationBusinessService
extends Object
    Business Service class which does the validation of incoming messages.

      • AgrValidationBusinessService

        public AgrValidationBusinessService()

    • Method Detail

      • validateConnectionGroup

        public void validateConnectionGroup(String usefIdentifier)
                             throws BusinessValidationException
        Validate if the Connection Group does exist. If not, the flex request will be rejected.
        Parameters:
        usefIdentifier - the usefIdentifier of the ConnectionGroup.
        Throws:
        BusinessValidationException - validation exception when business validation fails.

      • validatePTUsContainsDispositionRequested

        public void validatePTUsContainsDispositionRequested(List<PTU> ptus)
                                              throws BusinessValidationException
        Validate if there is a ptu with disposition=Requested.
        Parameters:
        ptus - the list of PTU's.
        Throws:
        BusinessValidationException - validation exception when business validation fails.

      • validatePrognosis

        public void validatePrognosis(String prognosisOrigin,
                              long prognosisSequence)
                       throws BusinessValidationException
        The flex request should map on the D-prognosis which is send earlier to the DSO. The DSO reacts with a flex request on the D-prognosis. So, if the D-prognosis does not exist based on origin and sequence, the flex request should be rejected.
        Parameters:
        prognosisOrigin - the origin of the prognosis.
        prognosisSequence - the sequence of the prognosis.
        Throws:
        BusinessValidationException - validation exception when business validation fails.

      • validateCorrespondingFlexOffer

        public void validateCorrespondingFlexOffer(FlexOrder order)
                                    throws BusinessValidationException
        This method first fetches a list of PtuFlexOffers based on the given FlexOrder's sequence and domain, then attempts to match the PTUs based on price and power. If it fails to find a match, it throws a BusinessValidationException.
        Parameters:
        order - the FlexOrder for which a matching FlexOffer to be found
        Throws:
        BusinessValidationException - when no matching FlexOffer is found for FlexOrder

      • validateFlexOrderTiming

        public void validateFlexOrderTiming(FlexOrder order)
                             throws BusinessValidationException
        FlexOrders should only be accepted if they refer to a future period or contain future PTU's with a power value != 0.
        Parameters:
        order - is the FlexOrder to validate
        Throws:
        BusinessValidationException
